Summary As the Public Policy manager of Google in Greece and other countries in the region, Dionisis' mission is to work with policy makers & other stakeholders towards the world's bright future in the Internet era. One path might be if the world adopts Google's commitment to innovation, in the same way as Google embraced ancient Greece's commitment to open democracy.  
 
Previously, as the General Manager of the Hellenic Semiconductor Industry Association (HSIA), Dionisis developed the HSIA brand and managed the stakeholder & media relations, resulting in TV, radio & print interviews. He organized events with the participation of global industry experts and VCs and secured new membership applications from Greece and abroad. 
 
Before that, Dionisis was a member of the Procter & Gamble External Relations team in the Global Household Care unit. In that role he designed and rolled out communication campaigns for P&G's laundry brands in Western Europe and in developing markets in Latin America, Eastern Europe, Middle East, South East Asia and in China.  
 
In his early P&G career, he worked on safety and regulatory compliance ensuring that new products and the manufacturing processes meet P&G standards and sustainability policies and comply with the law. He continued to be involved in sustainability issues and co-authored the P&G sustainability report in 2003 and 2004. 
 
Before joining P&G in 1999, Dionisis worked on European energy, environment and economic policy scenario analyses, which represents his lifetime opportunity to work in modeling (that was mathematical, not fashion modeling..). He holds a Master's in environmental management in business and an engineering degree.  
 
He has expertise in stakeholder & influencer relations, risk and crisis management. He is passionate about making technology, and sustainability relevant and easily understood by non-experts. 
 
Dionisis is the father of three energetic kids and the husband of a passionate communication consultant and author. Summary Carolyn Dalton is one of Australia’s best known and well respected policy lawyers and strategic thinkers. A copyright law specialist, she is also an expert adviser on internet and communications law and policy. 
 
As Executive Director of Policy Australia, Carolyn advises clients on a range of strategic, policy and legal issues. Areas of particular focus include the internet, media & communications, copyright and technology law and policy. Clients include internet companies such as Google and Netflix, peak body groups in the education sector, advocacy groups and rights holder organisations. 
 
Carolyn has spent over 15 years working with a wide range of government departments, industry bodies and major corporations as a legal adviser, public policy professional and government relations manager.  
 
Her previous roles include: 
 
- Head of Government Relations and Public Affairs, Google Australia & New Zealand 
 
- Special Counsel, Copyright & Communications, Minter Ellison Lawyers 
Representing clients such as the peak body for Australia’s school/TAFE sectors, Optus, the Motion Picture Association of America, the Interactive Games Association of Australia, the Australian Subscription Television and Radio Association, various government departments and cultural institutions. 
 
- Public Policy Manager, Telstra Regulatory 
 
- Principal Legal Officer, New Technologies Section, Copyright Law Branch, Commonwealth Attorney–General’s Department 
 
- Solicitor IP/IT Middletons Moore & Bevins 
 
Carolyn is on the Management Committee of the Copyright Society of Australia and was a Board Member of the Internet Industry Association. 
 
She was an advisory committee member for the Australian Law Reform Commission's review into Copyright and the Digital Economy and has been a member of the Australian Government's Consultative Group on Cybersafety. 
 
In 2001 Carolyn was awarded an Australia Day award for her work on the Copyright Amendment (Digital Agenda) Act 2000. Specialties:Copyright, internet, communications, media & technology law and policy
